item.title: Best RAM for Core i9-11900K
item.dc:creator: denis
item.description: The best 11th Gen flagship released in early 2021 is Intel Core i9-11900K. RAM speeds can make a big difference to the potential performance of Rocket Lake CPUs; that’s why it is recommended to choose the best RAM for i9-11900K. If you’re pushing the limits of performance, you can gain even more by selecting fast ... Read more
item.content:encoded:
The best 11th Gen flagship released in early 2021 is Intel Core i9-11900K. RAM speeds can make a big difference to the potential performance of Rocket Lake CPUs; that’s why it is recommended to choose the best RAM for i9-11900K. If you’re pushing the limits of performance, you can gain even more by selecting fast RAM and manually adjusting the timings for minimal latencies.

RAM will help you find the fastest memory kit for your system. Memory is one of the essential pieces of hardware in any CPU system. The right or wrong memory kit can significantly impact your overall system performance for gaming, productivity, and (if you don’t have enough) general sluggishness.

Indeed, it is true that RAM speed builds a massive difference for the potential performance of Rocket Lake CPUs. There is quite a bit of FPS at stake when playing games when you have limited CPU RAM.

Make sure XMP is enabled if you specify a faster memory kit. However, the H570 and B560 motherboards allow overclocking RAM for i9-11900k and higher RAM speeds. You must balance performance against cost so you can get the most out of your 11900K, whether you want an XMP profile set up and forgotten or have the time and skill to take full advantage of the overclockable RAM on this platform. If you’re pushing the limits of performance, you can gain even more by selecting fast RAM and manually adjusting the timings for minimal latencies. 

In this guide, we’ll go over our recommendations for the best RAM for i9-11900K.

Preview Product Rating Price
Corsair Vengeance RGB PRO 16GB (2x8GB) DDR4 3200MHz C16 LED... 37,189 Reviews $72.99 Buy now
Crucial Ballistix RGB 3600 MHz DDR4 DRAM Desktop Gaming Memory... 9,105 Reviews Buy now
G.Skill Trident Z RGB Series 32GB (2 x 16GB) 288-Pin SDRAM... 2,833 Reviews $113.99 Buy now
Patriot Viper Steel DDR4 16GB (2 x 8GB) 4400MHz Performance... 7,110 Reviews $107.99 Buy now
G.SKILL 32GB (2 x 16GB) Ripjaws V Series DDR4 PC4-25600 3200MHz... 3,694 Reviews $89.99 Buy now

How does RAM work?

RAM is intended for the short-term storage of data required by the PC for regular operation. However, unlike hard drives and SSDs, where data is stored indefinitely, RAM is cleared every time the system is rebooted. RAM only works when powered, distinguishing it from non-volatile storage devices such as hard drives and SSDs. Programs are loaded into RAM only for the duration of use, but at the same time, they are stored on drives permanently (until they are deleted).

What are the Important characteristics of RAM for i9-11900k?

Computers need quick access to temporary data to run programs and perform tasks. For example, modern computer games need to load graphic resources quickly. Games use RAM to read and write data because it is much faster than non-volatile storage devices.

Two factors included judging the characteristics of the RAM for i9-11900k.

  • Speed: Memory speed is measured in millions of transfer operations per second (MT / s), often confused with megahertz (MHz), although memory speed and clock speed are different. Higher memory speeds mean faster responsiveness to read and write requests and, therefore, better performance.
  • Capacity: It can be measured in gigabytes (GB). The chance to store more data applications when you have high storage capacity. With more RAM capacity, more applications can run simultaneously, and games can store more temporary data in it.

What kind of RAM is compatible with your motherboard?

Before you start thinking about RAM capacity and frequency, you need to make sure the RAM is compatible with your motherboard and your processor. Memory modules of the wrong type will not work, and if they do not meet the specifications, the memory performance will be lower than expected.

  • Module type

RAM is produced in the form of modules that are installed in connectors on the system board. RAM incompatible with your system will not fit or work properly. Modern motherboards support DDR4 memory modules. DDR4 memory should not be confused with DDR3 memory, which is the previous generation of SDRAM memory. These two types of memory modules are not interchangeable, and you cannot replace (for example) 8GB DDR3 memory with 16GB DDR4 memory.

  • DDR4 or SDRAM

Computers use random access memory (SDRAM). Synchronous DRAM is synchronized with the processor frequency. SDRAM has been continuously improved and now offers lower power consumption, faster data transfer rates, and more stable data transfers.

Modern computers use DDR4 or SDRAM memory as a standard. DDR4 – DDR technology is the fourth generation and has been replaced with SDRAM technology. DDR4 memory has increased data transfer rates, increased capacity, and lower operating voltage than previous-generation memory.

What speed of RAM do I need?

Find the right balance between capacity and speed. Chances are, 32GB of slow RAM won’t be ideal, as is 4GB of fast RAM. DDR4 memory speeds start at 1600MHz, but this is not fast by today’s standards. For example, the Intel Core i9-10900 processor supports 2933MHz memory in its base configuration.

In games, higher frequency RAM is beneficial. While the effect is not as noticeable as replacing the processor or graphics card, faster memory can also improve game performance and frame rates.

The performance improvement will vary from game to game; some games will run much faster, while others will be subtle. To assess the need for an update, you should look at the benchmark results with average frame rates.

In addition to raising the frame rate, faster memory can provide frame rate stability and faster frame loading. These figures will be presented in tests as low values ​​of 1% and 0.1% (average slowest indicator for 1% and 0.1% of recorded frames).

In addition to improving frame rates, fast RAM can improve game performance in other areas, including shorter loading times.

Editor’s choice:

I chose Corsair Vengeance PRO RAM for i9-11900k because it boosts speeds up to 4700MHz. I highly recommended Corsair Vengeance PRO because the perfect XMP 2.0 offers easy one-setting installation.

The Best RAM for i9-11900k

In this guide, we’ll go over our recommendations for the best RAM for the i9-11900K. The process of installing is super easy because of the smooth transition. 

Corsair Vengeance PRO 

When it comes to choosing high-grade processors, Corsair knows what is best for the high-potential system. So, if you are looking for the best RAM for i9-11900k, consider buying Corsair Vengeance PRO. Meanwhile, the overclocker will be able to choose this RAM, as it comes with high limits. The overclocking of Corsair Vengeance PRO RAM allows enhancing the speeds up to 4700MHz. 

With the additional feature of the aluminum head spreader, the chance of reliable memory cooling is higher. A user will find this a must-have feature while playing the game on PC. There is no chance of overheating when a user has Corsair Ram for i9-11900k; that’s why a user enjoys single thread speed. 

Corsair Ram is easy to install when you have a setting for intel XMP 2.0. It comes with a smooth transition without the desire for extra cables.

Crucial Ballistix RGB 3600:

Crucial Ballistix RGB 3600 is the perfect RAM for i9-11900k to achieve a high level of speed. However, it can’t be considered the fastest RAM, but it offers high performance at a reasonable price with reduced RAM latency and guaranteed stability without manual adjustments. The memory controller clock has 1800MHz speed for better performance, whereas it can be set to ‘Gear 1’ mode with this RAM. 

The Crucial Ballistix RGB 3600 kit has a clean black aesthetic that matches the capacity of most motherboards. It is also standard supply, which means that you can get matching DIMMS without facing any complex situation if you decide to upgrade capacity in the future. If you want to play games and know that your CPU is not affecting the potential performance with slow RAM, then Crucial Ballistix RGB 3600 is ideal.

Balancing appearance with gaming performance and keeping in mind the effect of four DIMMs on the memory controller, we recommend this 3200Mhz four × 8GB kit from G.Skill if you want a great-looking 32GB memory kit and high performance for games. 

The four DIMMs’ higher bandwidth slightly offsets the latency increase from a move to 3200MHz of RAM, and you can experiment with the Gear 1 vs. Gear 2 mode to see which one offers the best performance in your configuration; the difference is likely to be minimal.

 This is a tremendous-looking RAM kit with RGB, and 4 full DIMM slots are hands down the best-looking RAM configuration, meaning you will have a build on the fly to match the show, but at an affordable price. While higher speeds are available.

The Patriot Viper Steel is an ideal RAM for i9-11900k that seems perfect for experiments with overclocking on different CPUs and motherboards. It uses Samsung B-Die ICs, which are legendary for their flexibility and resistance to overclocking, even running high voltages with ease to ensure that last ounce of performance.

 While not the latest fastest spec, it represents an exceptional value in the overclocking space, with more specialized and exclusive kits costing three times as much. The paired 8Gb pair of DIMMs make the overclocking setup more stable, placing less load on the memory controller. If you want to dig deeper to find out what makes an i9-11900K tick, this memory kit is a great starting point to help you get familiar with ram overclocking.

Tips for having the RAM for i9-11900k?

It certainly helps, choosing a PC for a good amount of features. It doesn’t matter which brand is perfect; everything can be pushed or improved to accommodate more skills. This includes your system RAM for i9-11900k, which creates a massive difference to run programs.

It is normal to have doubts when deciding the exact model or speed that your system needs or which one to choose RAM, for i9-11900k. Indeed, the timing of clock speed (MHz) and RGB count for something. However, there is more to choose from than the best when looking for RAM.

Here are some tips to help you:

Heat diffusers and lights:

Heat spreaders are part of most RAM kits. RGB LEDs are exceptionally stylish. Both are basically for display. It is a fact that most of the memory does not run fast at the time of manual overclocking.

Somehow, they do not require aluminum or metal heat spreaders. Bare sticks are a great option; if there’s enough airflow to get through the case and over the memory. Also, the flashing lights don’t affect the performance of the RAM for i9-11900k. If you are looking for something flashy that comes with all the modern features, you can choose any RAM for Intel core i9-9900k. 

The clock speeds are excellent, but your system should support them:

Buying RAM with clock speeds that are not compatible with your system will hurt your pockets. Memory speed is limited on some CPUs, especially on lower-end Intel models. You should check what your system will allow and buy accordingly. There is no use buying a RAM rated at 3200 MHz when all your system can support is 2666 MHz. You will probably lack the high speeds to run your favorite programs. Always check the supported specs before opting for a new RAM.

16GB – perfect standard size:

At least, that is the case when the prices associated with said memory are considered. Mainstream programs or different games can run on 8GB, but other running programs could consume that. What you want, especially if you run heavy stuff, is more space. As such, 16GB or 32GB memories are worth a try.

Some programs and games do not need significant RAM speeds:

This is true even if you have identified the memory you want to pay. There are a lot of software programs that don’t benefit from faster and shorter memory.

If you are looking to recover some memory, you must research the games or programs you use the most. This way, you can use slower RAM in conjunction with a system that carries a dedicated graphics card.

Integrated graphics result in improved speeds:

Playing without a dedicated graphics card is fine. You’ll see improved frame rates with faster support memory, but if it takes longer to work on the components to support that speed, it’s essential to get a dedicated card. In this way, there is better gaming performance in all aspects.

Frequent questions

What is the best RAM speed for Intel i9-11900k?

Looking for the ideal RAM to give your system much-needed speed? There are several things to consider with your budget before making a move. First of all, speed is measured in MHz, and if you’re low on spending power, consider 2400 to 2666 MHz memory.

If you’re playing heavier games and enjoy smooth sessions, 3000–3200 MHz speeds are better. However, you will have to pay more for anything more significant than these options. The items reviewed here will give your workstation or gaming performance a superior speed.

How much RAM is ideal for intel core i9-11900k?

Maybe you want a RAM for i9-11900k; your Intel would require only a few significant components that create a great RAM for playing games or other options; first, check its measurement. If you want a computer for a less intensive program or some light games, 8GB of RAM will suffice. That will suffice for things like Microsoft Suite, surfing the web, and other light activities.

However, a game setup is a whole new level. If you add any significant software, such as video editing programs, you will need at least 16GB of RAM. It is even more efficient for playing video games that have high RAM demand and running more extensive programs.

These RAMs also help prepare your system build for the future in anticipation of next-gen consoles. The standard is 16GB, especially on a moderate budget.

What is the ideal RAM size for intel i9-11900k?

The higher the RAM, the better for the fancy side like streaming, raw file image editing, and hi-res movie playback. Many of us agree with the statement that 32GB RAM for i9-11900k is the perfect option, which means you have enough memory that enhances your CPU performance to running faster. 

Larger RAM will help your computer play a collective number of high-resolution movie stacks. Depending on what you choose to future-proof your PC, the ideal RAM for i9-11900k should be higher. 

What is the best option here?

While there are many options for ram for i9-11900k kits out there, but the above one is the perfect choice for those who want the reliable option. If you’re a gamer or use your system a lot, the Corsair Vengeance PRO is the ideal choice.

What is the mean of single-thread performance?

The single thread performance gives complete guidance about the CPU performance, faster response time, and better understanding. Today, the new intel core i9-11900k has the highest single-thread version. 

How to manually overclock RAM for i9-11900k?

Before overclocking, first, perform a stress test through a stable setting. It will initially allow you to check the quality and test for the stability of your RAM before starting overclocking. Once the process is completed, a user can change by increments such as:

  • Enhance DRAM voltage in increments
  • increase your CPU VCCIO Voltage
  • check the listed timing before the stay in the same setting 

What are the scenarios for different RAM modules?

If different RAM modules are installed, two scenarios are possible:

1) The system will start automatically, but on the timings and frequency of the slowest of the modules. 

2) To run the system, you’ll need to go to the motherboard bios, setting the same parameters for all memory modules.

Final words:

If you are looking to maximize your Core i9 CPU performance, our list of the best RAM for i9-11900k will come in handy. Whether you’re an advanced user or want a simple memory upgrade, these fast RAM kits offer excellent stability and reliability under the harshest conditions.

You can go for our top pick if you’re looking to combine top speed, great functionality, and minimizing heat while running heavy games. The RAM notch for i9-9900K exists within the options provided above.

item.title: Best RAM for the AMD Ryzen 9 5950X
item.dc:creator: Henzon
item.description: The ultimate flagship of the new Zen 3 Ryzen 5000 Series of CPUs – and currently the most powerful consumer-grade processor available – is the Ryzen 9 5950X. With a massive 16 cores, 32 threads, and 64 MB of L3 Cach, all fit into just two Core Complexes (CCX), this CPU has now also proven ... Read more
item.content:encoded:
The ultimate flagship of the new Zen 3 Ryzen 5000 Series of CPUs – and currently the most powerful consumer-grade processor available – is the Ryzen 9 5950X. With a massive 16 cores, 32 threads, and 64 MB of L3 Cach, all fit into just two Core Complexes (CCX), this CPU has now also proven that performs on par with its specifications; and completely dominates its competition in TechSpot’s benchmarks.

In order to harness the full potential this CPU is capable of, be it for workstation or for gaming applications, it will need RAM that is reliable, has a solid thermal solution, and, above all, has the right frequency/latency combination (which together calculate the absolute latency, in nanoseconds).

To provide you options for the perfect memory kit for your setup, we have compiled a list of RAM models suitable to enhance the Ryzen 9 5950X’s processing power – and we have done so based on price, quality, and availability.

Note: All prices are for dual channel kits of 16 GB (2x 8 GB) storage.

Related: Best Motherboard and Best CPU cooler for Ryzen 9 5950X

Recommended RAM Kits to pair with the AMD Ryzen 9 5950X

Preview Product Rating Price
TEAMGROUP T-Force Dark Pro Samsung IC 16GB Kit (2x8GB) DDR4 Dram... 156 Reviews $116.99 Buy now
Corsair Vengeance LPX 16GB (2x8GB) DDR4 3600 (PC4-28800) C141.45V... 113 Reviews $189.00 Buy now
G.Skill Trident Z Royal Series - DDR4-16 GB: 2 x 8 GB - DIMM... 4 Reviews $449.00 Buy now
16GB G.Skill Trident Z Neo DDR4 3800MHz PC4-30400 CL14 RGB Dual... 27 Reviews $356.77 Buy now

Best Gaming RAM for Ryzen 9 5950X – TEAMGROUP T-Force Dark Pro

Though somewhat overkill for a new gaming build, the R9 5950X is still the most powerful consumer CPU available in the market, even for gaming. A RAM kit with a 3,200 MHz frequency and a Column Address Strobe (CAS) latency of 14 cycles (8.75 nanoseconds absolute latency) will suffice for achieving the maximum gaming performance that this CPU can achieve.

The TeamGroup T-Force Dark Pro features XMP 2.0 compatibility, allowing you to save overclocking profiles (like a 3,600 MHz at CL 15) and access them in one step. Additionally, with its aluminum heat spreader and five-layer heatsink, you won’t have to worry about the RAM overheating – though a RAM fan-kit like the Corsair Dominator Platinum can always be used to provide additional cooling, together with an RGB lighting display which the T-Force Dark Pro lacks.

In terms of hardware components that optimize performance, the T-Force Dark Pro has both a JEDEC RC 2.0 custom circuit, which separates power and signal layers to avoid any interference, as well as a Samsung B-Die, which is the most optimal die for Ryzen CPUs. It has excellent CL timings of 14-14-14-31, which provide it with the ability to reach data transfer speeds of up to 24.6 GB/s.

The T-Force Dark Pro can currently be found at an incredibly low price of only $129.99, so do be sure to check it out if you’re looking for a RAM kit to accompany the R9 5950X for a new gaming rig.

Sale
156 Reviews
Best Gaming RAM for Ryzen 9 5950X - TEAMGROUP T-Force Dark Pro
  • Top craft of Five-Piece Heat Sink Unique trench design Improve heat dissipation
  • The transmitting performance can be greatly increased with JEDEC RC 2.0
  • Selected high quality original IC chips
  • QVL approved by motherboard manufacturers; XMP2.0 1 step overclocking technology
−$35.00 $116.99
Buy now
Check On Amazon

Best Low-Profile RAM for Ryzen 9 5950X – Corsair Vengeance LPX

Going a step above the 8.75 ns latency of the 3,200 MHz, CL 14 RAM kit, we have the Corsair Vengeance LPX: which features a frequency of 3,600 MHz, at a CAS latency of only 14 cycles, allowing it to achieve an absolute latency of 7.78 ns.

The Corsair Vengeance LPX, with its pure aluminum heat spread and custom-built PCB, allows for high-level overclocking that can be used for gaming and workstation applications alike. Like the aforementioned T-Force Dark Pro, it also has XMP 2.0 support, together with a low-profile design, that makes it compatible with all PC form factors, and won’t get in the way of a high-end air cooler like the NH-D15. The Vengeance LPX also has individually screened Integrated Circuits (IC), which translates to reliability and increased durability.

Because this kit is devoid of any RGB displays or additional external fluff, it’s price is low enough that it allows for several of these units to be purchased, for larger amounts of memory storage.

In fact, for only $179.99, one can attain 16 GB of dual-channel Corsair Vengeance LPX 3,600 MHz CL 14 RAM to pair with the Ryzen 9 5950X.

113 Reviews
Best Low-Profile RAM for Ryzen 9 5950X - Corsair Vengeance LPX
  • Hand-sorted memory chips ensure high performance with generous overclocking headroom
  • VENGEANCE LPX is optimized for wide compatibility with the latest Intel and AMD DDR4 motherboards
  • A low-profile height of just 34mm ensures that VENGEANCE LPX even fits in most small-form-factor builds
  • A solid aluminum heatspreader efficiently dissipates heat from each module so that they consistently run at...
$189.00
Buy now
Check On Amazon

Best High-Frequency RAM for Ryzen 9 5950X – G.Skill Trident Z Royal

Any frequencies above the 3,000 MHz mark is where we begin seeing diminishing returns in terms of performance, as there is a limit to how low absolute latency can go for the current generation, DDR4, memory units. Still, several workstation applications do need high-frequency RAM in order to better perform their associated tasks. If high-speed RAM is what you seek, then G.Skill’s Trident Z Royal 4,800 MHz CL 18 RAM is the way to go.

With an incredible absolute latency of 7.5 nanoseconds, the G.Skill Trident Z can run without the need for overclocking, though, of course, it can be overclocked to any speed that your motherboard can support. G.Skill’s Royal Series features an all-aluminum, CNC-cut, heat spreader (in either silver or gold color), hand-screened memory ICs, a custom 10-layer PCB, XMP 2.0 support, and a limited lifetime warranty. Its exterior aesthetics feature a unique jewel design, with a crystalline light-bar and an eight-zone controllable RGB display.

Of course, having such a high baseline frequency means that this RAM is definitely not cheap. Still, not having to worry about overclocking, as well as knowing that the RAM kit will have the reliability associated with G.Skill’s brand, makes its $509.00 price tag justifiable.

4 Reviews
Best High-Frequency RAM for Ryzen 9 5950X - G.Skill Trident Z Royal
  • F4-4800C18D-16GTRS
  • 288-Pin DDR4 SDRAM DDR4 4800
  • CAS Latency 18
  • Timing 18-22-22-42
$449.00
Buy now
Check On Amazon

Best Overall Performance RAM for Ryzen 9 5950X – G.Skill Trident Z Neo

Reaching a speed faster, even than that of a 4,800 MHz, CL 18 RAM module, we have the G.Skill Trident Z Neo’s 3,800 MHz CL 14 model. This combination of frequency and latency translates to an insane 7.37 nanosecond absolute latency, which is close to the best speed that baseline DDR4 RAM can inherently achieve.

To provide context to this claim, we can simply compare this model with a 5,000 MHz CL 18 RAM module, which offers a 7.20 ns latency (a difference of 0.17 ns), yet costs over $1,000 for two ranks of 8 GB: Almost five-times the cost of this 16 GB kit.

The Trident Z Neo offers everything a Ryzen 9 5950X processor needs, in order to achieve high performance. A Samsung B-Die, an aluminum heat spreader, a 10-layer PCB, hand-screened ICs, and XMP 2.0 compatibility. It also features a stylish design, with a dual-tone, brushed aluminum, and powder-coated exterior, as well as an eight-zone RGB lighting display.

The most impressive part about this RAM kit is its price. For only $219.92 you can attain memory that can be overclocked to the maximum speeds your motherboard can handle, at a low latency level and a reliable thermal solution. The ultimate RAM for the Ryzen 9 5950X.

27 Reviews
Best Overall Performance RAM for Ryzen 9 5950X - G.Skill Trident Z Neo
$356.77
Buy now

item.title: Best RAM for the AMD Ryzen 7 5800X
item.dc:creator: Henzon
item.description: AMD has released their Zen 3 Ryzen 5000 Series processors, and this highly anticipated pack of new CPUs sold out almost instantly. This is due to the fact that these new processors are capable of achieve the best possible performance the market has to offer; not just for multi-core, workstation and rendering applications, but also ... Read more
item.content:encoded:
AMD has released their Zen 3 Ryzen 5000 Series processors, and this highly anticipated pack of new CPUs sold out almost instantly. This is due to the fact that these new processors are capable of achieve the best possible performance the market has to offer; not just for multi-core, workstation and rendering applications, but also for single-core dependent workloads, like CAD processing and gaming. With the release of this Zen 3 architecture, AMD has effectively dethroned Intel as the gaming-processor king; and the CPU that seems to make the most out of this new architecture, is the Ryzen 7 5800X.

This 8-core, 16-thread, CPU utilizes a single CCX (Core Complex) to its maximum capacity. Of course, it must be mentioned that many argue that this CPU does not provide the best value for its cost, as it has a similar gaming framerate performance to the inferior Ryzen 5 5600X – despite costing $150 (50%) more. Benchmarks from TechSpot do, in fact, show us that the difference between these two processors is only a 6 FPS advantage for the R7 5800X (for an 11-game average). However, this is only currently the case for previous generation games.

As game developers strive to make full use of the 8-core, 16-thread, capacity of new-generation consoles, the extra cores and threads of the Ryzen 7 5800X will surely begin to accentuate the differences that make it superior to the Ryzen 5 5600X.

To ensure that the Ryzen 7 5800X performs at its hardware’s maximum capabilities, it will need a memory kit that allows it to reach its full potential. To help you find the appropriate RAM to pair with this newly released beast of a processor, we have compiled a list of the best RAM models based on their speed, quality, and price. This list is also heavily influenced by current availability, as we want to ensure that you can find this RAM as soon as you need it.

Note: All prices are for two ranks of 8 GB of RAM: 16 GB in total.

Related: Best CPU Coolers and Best Motherboards to pair with the Ryzen 7 5800X

Recommended RAM Kits to pair with the Ryzen 7 5800X

Preview Product Rating Price
Corsair CMW16GX4M2C3200C14 Vengeance RGB PRO 16GB (2x8GB) DDR4... 13,033 Reviews $350.00 Buy now
G.Skill Trident Z NEO Series 16GB (2 x 8GB) 288-Pin SDRAM... 156 Reviews $152.99 Buy now
TEAMGROUP T-Force Dark Pro Samsung IC 16GB Kit (2x8GB) DDR4 Dram... 156 Reviews $116.99 Buy now

Best Budget RAM for Ryzen 7 5800X – Crucial Ballistix RGB (3,600 MHz C16)

If you’ve allocated most of your budget on the CPU and GPU of your new build – and need the remaining hardware components to have a budget price – then Crucial has you covered.

The Crucial Ballistix RGB RAM kit features a speed of 3,600 MHz at a Column Address Strobe (CAS) latency of 16: The best RAM speed for those unwilling to overclock; proven in benchmarks by Wolfgang and GamerNexus to have the ability to supersede the 3,200 MHz CL 14 memory as the top performing RAM for gaming application.

What’s also great about the Crucial Ballistix RGB RAM kit is that it offers high quality at a budget price. Aluminum heat spreaders, 16-LED (eight-zone) RGB lighting displays, XMP 2.0 compatibility, and a low-profile form factor (for those building a Small Form Factor (SFF) PC that features the Ryzen 7 5800X) are all included at its incredibly low price-tag.

Indeed, for only $89.99 you can purchase the Crucial Ballistix RGB in its white-exterior iteration.

No products found.

Check On Amazon

Best Gaming RAM for Ryzen 7 5800X – Corsair Vengeance RGB PRO (3,200 MHz C14)

Though the 3,200 MHz CL 14 speed may fall short, versus a 3,600 MHz CL 16 RAM, in terms of framerate benchmarks, it has the ability to overclock to a 3,600 MHz CL 15 speed that surpasses the former by a sizable margin. In fact, when testing games to attain official benchmarks for their Zen 3 CPUs, and RDNA 2 GPUs, AMD uses RAM of these exact specifications.

The memory kit that features this high-performance frequency and latency combination, as well as all the spark associated with a dynamic multi-zone RGB lighting display, is the Corsair Vengeance RGB Pro. Each rank of this RAM features 10 individually-lit RGB LEDs, that can be customized via Corsair’s iCUE software.

To best optimize its overclocking performance, the Vengeance RGB Pro has a custom-built PCB, individually screened Integrated Circuits (IC), and an aluminum heat spreader that provides optimum heat dissipation.

The Corsair Vengeance RGB Pro can be found for $179.99: A price that is not cheap, but certainly worth it for gaming enthusiasts that desire that extra RGB pizzazz.

13,033 Reviews
Best Gaming RAM for Ryzen 7 5800X - Corsair Vengeance RGB PRO (3,200 MHz C14)
  • Dynamic Multi-Zone RGB Lighting: 10 Ultra-bright RGB LEDs per module
  • Next Generation Software: Take control in CORSAIR iCUE software and synchronize lighting with other CORSAIR...
  • Custom Performance PCB: Provides the highest signal quality for the greatest level of performance and...
  • Tightly Screened Memory: Carefully screened ICs for extended overclocking potential
$350.00
Buy now
Check On Amazon

Best Performance RAM for Ryzen 7 5800X – G.Skill Trident Z Neo Series (3,600 MHz C14)

When it comes to performance, nothing beats what that the G.Skill Trident Z Neo Series RAM offers at its 3,600 MHz CAS 14 iteration. This frequency/CAS combination creates an absolute latency of only 7.78 nanoseconds – beating both 3,600 MHz C16 and 3,400 MHz C14 speeds by 1.1 and 0.46 nanoseconds respectively.

As with most G.Skill RAM kits, the Trident Z Neo features a Samsung B-Die, which is the best die to pair with AMD’s Ryzen CPUs. Additionally, this RAM has a 10-layer PCB and hand-screened ICs; ensuring better reliability, as well as longevity.

If you want the hardware of your PC to be flashy, then this RAM will not let you down. It has a dual-tone aluminum heat spreader with a beveled, tri-finned, edge, and, in between these edges, lie RGB displays that are lit with eight zones that are capable of displaying 1.68 million colors.

For the 3,600 MHz CL 14 G.Skill Trident Z Neo Series kit, you can expect to pay only $174.99.

156 Reviews
Best Performance RAM for Ryzen 7 5800X - G.Skill Trident Z Neo Series (3,600 MHz C14)
  • Brand: G.Skill, Series: Trident Z NEO, Model: F4-3600C14D-16GTZNB
  • 16GB kit containing 2 x 8GB modules, DDR4-3600, 288-Pin, CAS Latency CL14 (14-15-15-35) at 1.45V
  • XMP 2.0 profile support to reach up to the rated overclock speed, or run at default JEDEC profile speed
  • Rated XMP frequency & stability depends on MB & CPU capability.
$152.99
Buy now
Check On Amazon

Best Value RAM for Ryzen 7 5800X – TEAMGROUP T-Force Dark Pro (3,200 MHz C14)

When it comes to getting the best performance for each dollar expended, a RAM kit with a frequency of 3,200 MHz and latency of 14 CAS is the way to go.

For this RAM type, TeamGroup has created the T-Force Dark Pro: A RAM model that combines high-quality materials, a Samsung B-Die, and excellent CAS timings (14-14-14-31), at an incredibly low price. This is what makes this kit the ultimate value RAM to pair with a Ryzen 7 5800X.

With a JEDEC RC 2.0 custom circuit board that separates power and signal layers – effectively increasing transmission signal by up to 35% – the T-Force Dark Pro is capable of reaching data-transfer speeds of up to 24.6 GB/s. Additionally, its XMP 2.0 compatibility allows for one-step overclocking, and, given that this RAM has a five-layer heatsink and an all-aluminum heat spreader, this feature can be used on a regular basis.

A kit of this memory will only cost you $129.99: an excellent investment for RAM that is devoid of any fluff, and focuses purely on achieving a maximum level of performance.

Sale
156 Reviews
Best Value RAM for Ryzen 7 5800X - TEAMGROUP T-Force Dark Pro (3,200 MHz C14)
  • Top craft of Five-Piece Heat Sink Unique trench design Improve heat dissipation
  • The transmitting performance can be greatly increased with JEDEC RC 2.0
  • Selected high quality original IC chips
  • QVL approved by motherboard manufacturers; XMP2.0 1 step overclocking technology
−$35.00 $116.99
Buy now

item.title: Best RAM for the AMD Ryzen 9 5900X
item.dc:creator: Henzon
item.description: It did not take long for AMD’s initial batch of Zen 3 Ryzen 5000 Series processors to completely sell out. This can, in part, be attributed to a lack of stock, but it cannot be denied that the demand for these CPUs is off the charts – and for good reason. The flagship Ryzen 9 ... Read more
item.content:encoded:
It did not take long for AMD’s initial batch of Zen 3 Ryzen 5000 Series processors to completely sell out. This can, in part, be attributed to a lack of stock, but it cannot be denied that the demand for these CPUs is off the charts – and for good reason.

The flagship Ryzen 9 5900X, for example, outclasses AMD’s chief competitor, Intel, in multiple facets associated with CPU performance; while still costing less than Intel’s flagship CPU. It has two additional cores, four additional threads, more than three times the amount of L3 Cache, and a half-sized processing node; allowing it to have far better multicore performance, and, with the new Zen 3 CCX (Core Complex) architecture, it also performs similarly to the Intel i9-10900K in single-core dependent workloads, like gaming applications, as well. In fact, TechSpot’s benchmarks show us that the Ryzen 9 5900X achieves this level of performance, despite consuming 23% less power than its Intel counterpart. Note, that these benchmarks are carried out using an Nvidia GPU, which means that the Smart Access Memory feature found in Ryzen 5000 Series CPUs and Radeon RX 6000 Series GPUs is not being utilized.

If you are looking to build a new PC around the Ryzen 9 5900X, you will want its accompanying hardware components to allow it to reach its maximum potential – and RAM is one of the most important pieces to needed in order to accomplish this task. To help you find the best memory the market has to offer, we have compiled a list of the most optimal RAM kits to pair with the Ryzen 9 5900X – based on speed, price, and, of course, availability.

Note: All prices are for two ranks of 8 GB of RAM: 16 GB in total.

Related: Best motherboards for Ryzen 9 5900X, and Recommended aftermarket coolers for Ryzen 9 5900X

List of the Recommended RAM kits for the AMD Ryzen 9 5900X

Preview Product Rating Price
G.Skill Trident Z NEO Series 16GB (2 x 8GB) 288-Pin PC4-28800... 1,654 Reviews $109.99 Buy now
TEAMGROUP T-Force Dark Pro Samsung IC 16GB Kit (2x8GB) DDR4 Dram... 156 Reviews $116.99 Buy now
Corsair Vengeance LPX 16GB (2x8GB) DDR4 3600 (PC4-28800) C141.45V... 113 Reviews $189.00 Buy now
16GB G.Skill Trident Z Neo DDR4 3800MHz PC4-30400 CL14 RGB Dual... 27 Reviews $356.77 Buy now

Best RGB Gaming RAM for Ryzen 9 5900X – G.Skill Trident Z Neo

One of the more popular RAM speeds for gaming applications is that which has a 3,600 MHz frequency, and a Column Address Strobe (CAS) latency of 16 cycles. This speed has proven to provide framerates above what the conventional 3,200 MHz CL14 is capable of when not overclocking – as proven by benchmarks from Wolfgang and GamerNexus for a multitude of gaming titles. So, if you do not want to worry about overclocking your RAM on a regular basis, this speed is perfect for your build. One of the best models featuring this speed: The G.Skill’s Trident Z Neo.

This RAM has it all. A Samsung B-Die (which is the best die to pair with AMD’s Ryzen CPUs), an excellent heat spreader with a brushed aluminum and powder-coated silver exterior, a 10-layer PCB, hand-screened Integrated Circuits (IC), and a stylish slanted and asymmetrical RGB displays that features eight-zone RGB lighting.

Purchasing G.Skill’s Trident Z Neo Series RAM can currently cost you as low as $125.08; for prices do fluctuate depending on season and availability.

1,654 Reviews
Best RGB Gaming RAM for Ryzen 9 5900X - G.Skill Trident Z Neo
  • Brand: G.SKILL, Series: Trident Z Neo, Model: F4-3600C16D-16GTZNC
  • Capacity: 16GB (2x8GB), Type: 288-Pin DDR4 SDRAM, Speed: DDR4 3600 (PC4 28800), CAS Latency: 16, Timing:...
  • XMP 2.0 profile support to reach up to the rated overclock speed, or run at default JEDEC profile speed
  • Rated XMP frequency & stability depends on MB & CPU capability
$109.99
Buy now
Check On Amazon

Best Non-RGB Gaming RAM for Ryzen 9 5900X – TEAMGROUP T-Force Dark Pro

Though a 3,600 MHz CL16 speed does offer slightly better frame rates for gaming, it is inferior to a 3,200 MHz CL14 RAM in terms of absolute latency (8.88 nanoseconds vs 8.75 nanoseconds respectively). This means that the 3,200 MHz RAM can be overclocked to even faster speeds, such as 3,600 MHz CL15, and therefore increase overall performance.

The TeamGroup T-Force Dark Pro RAM kit does make this task very simple, as it has XMP 2.0 compatibility – so you can save overclocking profiles and execute the task in just one step – and, with its five-layer heatsink and aluminum heat spreader, you won’t have to worry about overheating issues affecting the hardware or its performance. 

The T-Force Dark Pro also features an JEDEC RC 2.0 custom circuit that increases transmission signal by a significant amount (up to 35%) by using an architecture that separates the power layer and signal layer circuits. Together with the Ryzen optimized Samsung B-Die, this RAM features data transfer speeds of 24.6 GB/s.

Bereft of any lighting displays or exterior fluff, this RAM makes the most of its 3,200 MHz frequency and 14-14-14-31 CAS timing; and it does so at an incredibly low price of only $129.99.

Sale
156 Reviews
RGB Gaming RAM for Ryzen 9 5900X - TEAMGROUP T-Force Dark Pro
  • Top craft of Five-Piece Heat Sink Unique trench design Improve heat dissipation
  • The transmitting performance can be greatly increased with JEDEC RC 2.0
  • Selected high quality original IC chips
  • QVL approved by motherboard manufacturers; XMP2.0 1 step overclocking technology
−$35.00 $116.99

Best Low-Profile RAM for Ryzen 9 5900X – Corsair Vengeance LPX

As DDR4 RAM technology has progressed, so have manufacturing techniques and efficiency. This has resulted in high-performance RAM, at a much lesser price than what was initially available. It is for this reason that we now have the luxury to find 3,600 MHz CL 14 RAM at a price that used to simply be unapproachable.

The Corsair Vengeance LPX features this exact speed, that allows for high-level overclocking for both gaming and workstation purposes. The Vengeance LPX has a pure aluminum heat spreader and a custom-built PCB, which, together, allow it to achieve and maintain its overclocking capabilities.

It also has individually screened ICs, for increased durability, and XMP 2.0 support, so you can save overclocking profiles for quick and easy access. Finally, it must be mentioned that this RAM kit features a low-profile design, and, thus, it can fit into a PC of any form-factor.

The Corsair Vengeance LPX may not have a RGB-illuminated display, or a flashy exterior design, but it performs at incredible speeds, and will only cost you $179.99.

  • A low-profile height of just 34mm ensures that VENGEANCE LPX even fits in most small-form-factor builds
  • A solid aluminum heatspreader efficiently dissipates heat from each module so that they consistently run at...
$189.00

Best Overall RAM for Ryzen 9 5900X – G.Skill Trident Z Neo

For yet another category, we must give props to G.Skill for their Trident Z Neo Series, as it achieves mind-blowing speeds at an incredibly low price. Here, we have a model that has a frequency of 3,800 MHz and a CAS timing of 14 cycles; meaning that this RAM has an absolute latency of 7.37 nanoseconds. This absolute latency is actually close to what a 5,000 MHz CL 18 RAM offers, despite costing nearly one-fifth of its price, for a speed boost of only 0.17 ns.

Indeed, for just $219.92 you can purchase 16 GBs of this RAM model, which is nearly equivalent to memory that costs $1,079.99, for the same amount of storage. Included, of course, are all the aforementioned features, quality of materials, RGB display, and Samsung B-die that accompany all G.Skill Trident Z Series RAM kits.

Best Overall RAM for Ryzen 9 5900X - G.Skill Trident Z Neo
$356.77

item.title: Best RAM for Ryzen 5 5600X Processor
item.dc:creator: Henzon
item.description: Its been an exciting moment for gamers as AMD announced their Zen 3 Ryzen 5000 series CPUs, and as time goes by, we get additional tidbits of information regarding the performance of these highly anticipated processors. The most recent release of information we’ve had dealt with the single-thread performance of the least expensive Zen 3 ... Read more
item.content:encoded:
Its been an exciting moment for gamers as AMD announced their Zen 3 Ryzen 5000 series CPUs, and as time goes by, we get additional tidbits of information regarding the performance of these highly anticipated processors.

The most recent release of information we’ve had dealt with the single-thread performance of the least expensive Zen 3 model: The Ryzen 5 5600X. Not only did these PassMark benchmarks show a generational leap of 47%, compared to the (Ryzen 5 3600XT) but they also display the Ryzen 5 5600X outperforming every single 9th and 10th generation Intel CPU by a margin of at least 10% – its difference with the i9-10900K. Considering how much gaming applications are dependent on single-core performance, as well as the fact that few if any, games utilize more than 6 cores and 12 threads, this CPU is primed to be an excellent money-for-value option for gaming rigs.

To maintain high framerates, the CPU depends heavily on the performance of the RAM it’s paired with. Choosing the proper speed and latency can affect performance by a huge margin – as shown by GamersNexus’s benchmarks, proving that the i5-10600K can outperform the i9-10900K solely based on RAM kits.

When purchasing RAM, there are certain aspects that are incredibly important to ensure compatibility. Such aspects include: The storage size, the overall speed of the RAM (which includes both clock speed and CAS latency), whether the RAM is a single channel or dual channel, how clunky the heat-spreader or heatsinks are (to make sure they fit underneath the CPU cooler of choice or an SFF build) and, of course, whether or not they feature RGB lighting for those that want to game in style.

Taking all the above into consideration, we’ve compiled a list of the best RAM for the Ryzen 5 5600X, depending on speed, storage, and price.

Related articles: Best motherboard and best CPU cooler for the AMD Ryzen 5 5600X

Best RAM Kit for the AMD Ryzen 5 5600X

Preview Product Rating Price
Crucial Ballistix RGB 3600 MHz DDR4 DRAM Desktop Gaming Memory... 9,025 Reviews Buy now
G.Skill Trident Z NEO Series 16GB (2 x 8GB) 288-Pin PC4-28800... 1,654 Reviews $109.99 Buy now
G.Skill Flare X Series 16GB (2 x 8GB) 288-Pin SDRAM (PC4-25600)... 799 Reviews $99.99 Buy now
TEAMGROUP T-Force Dark Pro Samsung IC 16GB Kit (2x8GB) DDR4 Dram... 156 Reviews $116.99 Buy now

Best Budget 3600 MHz CL 16 RAM for Ryzen 5 5600X – Crucial Ballistix RGB

Crucial, a brand of Micron, makes some of the best memory units for both RAM and ROM SSDs, at incredibly low prices. Their Crucial Ballistix RGB series RAM units provide high frequencies, low CAS latency, and RGB lighting to boot – and they are also available in three colors: White, black, and red.

When it comes to RAM speeds, gaming benchmarks prove (Wolfgang, GamerNexus) that the current sweet spot lies between 3,200 MHz at CL14, and 3,600 MHz at CL16, with the slight performance edge going to the latter. Of course, the former can be overclocked to a 3,600 MHz CL15 speed, which will outperform the 3,600 MHz variants; but if you don’t want to go through the trouble of overclocking, 3,600 MHz CL16 is the way to go.

The Crucial Ballistix RGB features 16 GB of 3,600 CL16 RAM, with a low-profile form factor and aluminum heat spreaders. The RGB atop the RAM includes 16 LEDs separated into eight zones, and is compatible with ASUS Aura, MSI Mystic Light, Gigabyte AORUS, and more. XMP 2.0 profiles are also included, for automatic overclocking.

Considering that these RAM two ranks of 8 GB cost only $89.99, buying the Ballistix RGB is a no-brainer for gaming enthusiasts.

9,025 Reviews
3600 MHz CL 16 RAM for Ryzen 5 5600X - Crucial Ballistix RGB
  • Ideal for gamers and performance enthusiasts
  • Customize your rig’s color scheme with 16 RGB LEDs in 8 zones on each module
  • Compatible with ASUS Aura, MSI Mystic Light, Gigabyte AORUS Graphics Engine, and more
  • XMP 2.0 support for automatic overclocking, or run at JEDEC default profile
Buy now
Check On Amazon

Best Performance 3600 MHz CL16 RAM for Ryzen 5 5600X – G.Skill Trident Z Neo Series

For those looking to invest a bit extra for high-quality Samsung B-die RAM, G.Skill offers their stylish Trident Z Neo Series RAM units.

Once again clocking at 3,600 MHz, with a 16-19-19-39 (CAS 16) timing and a Samsung B-die (which is optimized for AMD Ryzen Series CPUs) the Trident Neo Z Series offers incredible performance with a flashy exterior: A dual-tone, brushed aluminum heat spreader is enhanced with a tri-finned, beveled, edge and an 8-zone RGB lighting running across the top.

Each rank of RAM also includes a 10-layer PCB and hand screened memory integrated circuits (ICs), for better durability and reliability.

Two ranks of 8 GBs each, of the G.Skill Trident Z Neo Series, will only cost you $114.99; which is a bit higher than the aforementioned Crucial Ballistix RGB, but arguably a small price to pay for the integrated Samsung B die which works best with Ryzen series CPUs.

1,654 Reviews
3600 MHz CL16 RAM for Ryzen 5 5600X - G.Skill Trident Z Neo Series

  • Capacity: 16GB (2x8GB), Type: 288-Pin DDR4 SDRAM, Speed: DDR4 3600 (PC4 28800), CAS Latency: 16, Timing:...
  • XMP 2.0 profile support to reach up to the rated overclock speed, or run at default JEDEC profile speed
  • Rated XMP frequency & stability depends on MB & CPU capability
$109.99
Buy now
Check On Amazon

Best Budget 3200 MHz CL14 RAM for Ryzen 5 5600X – G.SKILL Flare X Series

RAM units with lesser clock speeds and lower CAS latency, will perform similarly – and, in some cases, even better – than higher speed and latency models. The 3,200 MHz CL14 RAM provides you with the flexibility to overclock to 3,600 or 3,800 MHz, at CL15 or CL16, so if you are willing to overclock your RAM, they will provide you with a significant performance boost.

G.Skill, this time with the Flare X Series model, offers a 3,200 MHz CL14 model at an incredibly low price; keeping all the same performance-dependent hardware but removing any RGB flare in order to focus on function rather than style. Note that these units are not low-profile, so chances are they will not fit properly into a small form factor (SFF) case.

This 3,200 MHz, 14-14-14-34 CAS timings, a dual-channel kit of 16 GB (8 GB per rank) comprise the hardware of the Flare X Series, with additional XMP 2.0 compatibility that allows for automatic overclocking via the use of preset profiles.

Considering that this 16 GB of RAM costs only $99.99, makes them the best price-for-value RAM available for the specification parameters.

799 Reviews
3200 MHz CL14 RAM for Ryzen 5 5600X - G.SKILL Flare X Series
  • XMP 2.0 profile support to reach up to the rated overclock speed, or run at default JEDEC profile speed
  • Rated XMP frequency & stability depends on MB & CPU capability
  • Check G.Skill QVL or RAM Configurator on the G.Skill website for validated motherboards
$99.99
Buy now
Check On Amazon

Best Performance 3200 MHz CL14 RAM for Ryzen 5 5600X – TEAMGROUP T-Force Dark Pro

Whether it be for workstations or gaming rigs, the TeamGroup T-Force Dark Pro RAM is the best 3,200 MHz CL 14 (14-14-14-31) RAM that money can buy. It can transfer data at speeds of up to 24.6 GB/s, making use of a JEDEC RC 2.0 custom circuit board that separates power and signal layers, increasing transmission signal by up to 35%.

Also making use of XMP technology, the T-Force Dark Pro allows for multiple overclocking profiles that can be customized for one-step overclocking. What’s particularly special about this RAM, is the fact that it has a five-layer heatsink, in addition to its aluminum heat spreader, which allows for stable overclocking without the worry of overheating the RAM.

Given the speed, the quality of build, and the integrated Samsung B die, the $129.99 price tag of the TeamGroup T-Force Dark Pro is incredibly low, even considering its lack of RGB lighting.

item.title: Best RAM for i9 9900k Processor
item.dc:creator: Henzon
item.description: Intel Core i9-9900K processor has been the best processor for gaming for years, AMD is slowly catching up and may have surpassed the Intel Core i9-9900K processor, but many currently use the Intel Core i9-9900K in their gaming setups. The Intel Core i9-9900K features eight cores and a total of sixteen threads with a maximum ... Read more
item.content:encoded:
Intel Core i9-9900K processor has been the best processor for gaming for years, AMD is slowly catching up and may have surpassed the Intel Core i9-9900K processor, but many currently use the Intel Core i9-9900K in their gaming setups. The Intel Core i9-9900K features eight cores and a total of sixteen threads with a maximum turbo frequency of 5.00 GHz. This processor launched back in 2018, which has a maximum TDP of 95-watts.

For the Intel Core i9-9900K having a fast RAM speed and lowest CAS latency possible, these specifications are highly important for any Gaming or video editing computer.

Pairing the Intel Core i9-9900K with the correct RAM is important, some softwares and games require higher available RAM or need faster RAM speeds.

This article focuses on four different RAM kits which are perfect for a variety of different scenarios ranging from value RAM kits to even the fanciest RAM kit. This wide variety of different RAM kits allow for PC builders to buy the RAM kit that fits best with their perfect PC system.

Best RAM Kit for Intel Core i9-9900k Processor

Preview Product Rating Price
Corsair Vengeance LPX 16GB (2 X 8GB) DDR4 3600 MHz (PC4-28800)... 70,634 Reviews $63.99 Buy now
G.Skill Trident Z Royal Series [Gold] 16GB (2 x 8GB) 288-Pin... 207 Reviews $105.99 Buy now
Corsair Vengeance RGB PRO 16GB (2x8GB) DDR4 3200MHz C16 LED... 37,189 Reviews $72.99 Buy now
OLOy DDR4 RAM 16GB (2x8GB) 3000 MHz CL16 1.35V 288-Pin Desktop... 6,517 Reviews $45.99 Buy now

Best Performance RAM for i9 9900k – Corsair Vengeance LPX 16GB

Some users, mostly gamers, enjoy having the fastest RAM possible. The Intel Core i9-9900K processor when paired with the Corsair Vengeance LPX 16 GB DDR4-3600 offers a great gaming experience while still allowing your PC to work perfectly with Adobe Photoshop and Adobe Premiere Pro.

The Vengeance LPX 16 GB RAM kit has the fastest speed of all the RAM kits listed in this article, So if your next PC needs the fastest possible speed, then this RAM kit is perfect for you!

This RAM kit is perfect for a sleeper PC or a workstation PC that doesn’t need all the RGB lighting that many RAM kits have installed. The simplistic design of the Vengeance LPX has just a 34 mm height means that this RAM will fit into nearly any PC regardless of the installed CPU cooler.

The Corsair Vengeance LPX 16 GB RAM kit is currently available on Amazon for just $67.99 with free shipping. This RAM kit is currently on sale for up to 40% off, the list price is $114.00.

Fancy RAM for i9 9900k – G.Skill 16 GB DDR4 Trident Z Royal Gold

If your PC is designed to show off your internal components, then the G.Skill 16 GB Trident Z Royal Gold Kit is a perfect choice. This kit might look amazing, but this kit also features some amazing specifications.

Some of the specifications that PC builders need to keep in mind is the RAM speed, this ram kit offers a RAM speed of 3,200 MHz, and the CAS latency which is 16. These specifications match well with the Intel Core i9-9900K processor. The Intel Core i9-9900K Processor can make use of the lowered latency and faster RAM speeds, offering the best performance possible while still maintaining a fair price tag.

The Gold coloring looks perfect for any fancy PC system that uses a Gold or Silver color scheme for the internal components. The Solid Gold will get a large amount of attention directed right to these RAM modules, and any nearby components which can include the CPU cooler or the Motherboard that these RAM modules are connected to.

This RAM kit is currently available on Newegg and the price tag associated with the RAM kit is $109.99. This price tag is a bit more expensive when compared to the first RAM kit on this list, but users pay for the gold coloring and the unique RGB diffusers.

Best RGB RAM for i9 9900k – Corsair Vengeance RGB PRO 16 GB

If your PC is looking to utilize a large amount of RGB lighting, through the various installed components which include the RAM kit. The Corsair Vengeance RGB PRO RAM Kit utilizes a solid black heat spreader and an RGB diffuser located on the top of the RAM stick. This RAM kit is available through Amazon, This RAM kit has a featured price tag of $85.02 which is still a great value when compared to some of the other RAM manufacturers.

This RAM kit features an RGB diffuser located on the top of the RAM stick, this RAM stick features ten individually addressable RGB LEDs that can be chosen from dozens of preset lighting profiles or create custom presets in your own Corsair iCUE software.

This RAM kit can be paired with the Intel Core i9-9900K for both value, performance, and lighting while offering a good gaming experience or video editing experience.

Corsair’s RGB LEDs require no extra wires or cables for a clean and seamless install which allows users to just connect the modules through the RAM slot.

This RAM kit is currently on sale at Amazon, normally this RAM kit costs $94.99 but has a 10% sale which drops down the price to just $85.02.

If the Intel Core i9-9900K processor took a large amount of your PC budget, then this RAM kit is a perfect choice as it only costs $50.99. Many would assume with the lowered price that the OLOy DDR4 RAM kit is significantly slower than the previous entries, but not so because this RAM kit offers a RAM speed of 3,000 MHz and a CAS latency of 16.

Both of those specifications will work with the Intel Core i9-9900k processor, the CAS latency ensures that Windows Explorer program is snappy and works at an incredible speed when compared to slower RAM kits.

One thing that isn’t prevalent in the OLOy DDR4 RAM kit is any RGB lights or an RGB diffuser. This lack of RGB lighting may make this RAM kit less desirable, but for budget gaming builds that want to spend more of the budget on the Intel Core i9-9900K processor.

item.title: How Much RAM Is Recommended for Streaming?
item.dc:creator: Henzon
item.description: The number of people who are streaming in recent years is constantly increasing. PC building has become more popular nowadays, and it’s because of the amount of gaming as well as streaming that’s out there. Numerous people on forums such as Reddit are asking questions about what’s the ideal PC specs for streaming and how ... Read more
item.content:encoded:
The number of people who are streaming in recent years is constantly increasing. PC building has become more popular nowadays, and it’s because of the amount of gaming as well as streaming that’s out there. Numerous people on forums such as Reddit are asking questions about what’s the ideal PC specs for streaming and how much RAM do they need? In this article, we will be focusing on RAM, and you will find out later on how much RAM do you actually need for streaming.

Streaming platforms like Twitch, YouTube, and Mixer requires you to have multiple processes running at once, which can take up a very large portion of the RAM capacity you have available. If your RAM is unable to keep up with the required processing power, it will result in poor stream quality. So, how much RAM do I need for streaming?

Is 4 GB of RAM enough for streaming?

Generally speaking, 4 GB isn’t enough for live streaming. The truth is that most games today require more than 4 GB of RAM alone. Likewise, considering the OBS streaming software, Discord, and other applications you have running, it turns out to be certain that 4 GB of RAM is decent enough for gaming but not streaming.

Will 8 GB of RAM be enough for streaming?

The short answer is yes, 8 GB of RAM is considered the bare minimum for streaming. However, games are slowly increasing their requirements and new games today are more demanding. Maybe an 8 GB of RAM is good for now, but the days are slowly coming to an end. Also, 8 GB is more than a viable choice, it’s a great way to cut costs.

Is 16 GB of RAM Good Enough for Streaming?

Well, 16 gigabytes is undoubtedly the way to go right now especially if you aren’t on a tight budget. Yes, 16 GB is the recommended and the majority also says that it would be the sweetest spot for streaming. 16 GB RAM will give you enough room for running multiple software at the same time. 16 GB is also good for future proofing your build. Just like what I said earlier, you are now able to run software like OBS, Discord, and other software that are required for streaming.

Other Things To Consider:

Single Vs. Multiple RAM Module

Should you buy single or multiple brand modules? Nearly every motherboard supports dual channel memory nowadays, while some even support quad channels. Dual-channel will give you a performance boost, we all know that. But this post is hardly substantial, you probably won’t even notice it in some PC activities. Instead, the main advantage of having multiple Ram modules is that they offer a greater contingency in case of failure, and are much cheaper to repair. For example, you have a 16 GB module and it breaks, your whole computer will be unstable until you replace it with a new one. But if you have 8 GB modules and one break, your computer will operate just fine on the remaining one.

RAM Frequency

The higher the frequency of your RAM the better. Contingent upon the game you’re streaming, some demanding games require more computational power so I would recommend you to get a much faster RAM. We recommend you to go with the 3200 MHz, it is the sweetest spot RAM speed that you can use for streaming to achieve decent performance.
